00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup USART_Private_Define USART private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 #define CR_CLEAR_Mask             ((u32)0xFFFFE0FC)
00046 
00047 #define USART_BREAK_ON            ((u32)0x00004000)
00048 #define USART_BREAK_OFF           ((u32)0xFFFFBFFF)
00049 
00050 #define USART_PBE_ON              ((u32)0x00000800)
00051 #define USART_SPE_ON              ((u32)0x00002000)
00052 #define USART_SPE_OFF             ((u32)0xFFFFDFFF)
00053 
00054 #define USART_EN_ON               ((u32)0x00000010)
00055 
00056 #define USART_HFCEN_ON            ((u32)0x00000008)
00057 #define USART_HFCEN_OFF           ((u32)0xFFFFFFF7)
00058 
00059 #define USART_RXTOEN_ON           ((u32)0x00000080)
00060 
00061 #define FCR_TL_Mask               ((u32)0x00000030)
00062 
00063 #define TRSM_CLEAR_Mask           ((u32)0xFFFFFFFB)
00064 #define TPR_TG_Mask               ((u32)0xFFFF00FF)
00065 #define ICR_IRDAPSC_Mask          ((u32)0xFFFF00FF)
00066 #define TPR_RXTOIC_Mask           ((u32)0xFFFFFF80)
00067 #define RS485CR_ADDM_Mask         ((u32)0xFFFF00FF)
00068 
00069 #define USART_IRDA_ON             ((u32)0x00000001)
00070 #define USART_IRDA_OFF            ((u32)0xFFFFFFFE)
00071 
00072 #define USART_INV_ON              ((u32)0x00000010)
00073 
00074 #define USART_RS485NMM_ON         ((u32)0x00000002)
00075 #define USART_RS485NMM_OFF        ((u32)0xFFFFFFFD)
00076 
00077 #define USART_RS485AAD_ON         ((u32)0x00000004)
00078 #define USART_RS485AAD_OFF        ((u32)0xFFFFFFFB)
00079 /**
00080   * @}
00081   */

00087 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00088  * @brief Deinitialize the USART/UART peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00089  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00090  * @retval None
00091  ************************************************************************************************************/
00092 void USART_DeInit(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx)
00093 {
00094   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00095   u32 uIPAddr = (u32)USARTx;
00096 
00097   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00098   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00099 
00100   switch (uIPAddr)
00101   {
00102     #if (!LIBCFG_NO_USART0)
00103     case HT_USART0_BASE:
00104     {
00105       RSTCUReset.Bit.USART0 = 1;
00106       break;
00107     }
00108     #endif
00109     #if (LIBCFG_USART1)
00110     case HT_USART1_BASE:
00111     {
00112       RSTCUReset.Bit.USART1 = 1;
00113       break;
00114     }
00115     #endif
00116     case HT_UART0_BASE:
00117     {
00118       RSTCUReset.Bit.UART0 = 1;
00119       break;
00120     }
00121     #if (LIBCFG_UART1)
00122     case HT_UART1_BASE:
00123     {
00124       RSTCUReset.Bit.UART1 = 1;
00125       break;
00126     }
00127     #endif
00128     #if (LIBCFG_UART2)
00129     case HT_UART2_BASE:
00130     {
00131       RSTCUReset.Bit.UART2 = 1;
00132       break;
00133     }
00134     #endif
00135     #if (LIBCFG_UART3)
00136     case HT_UART3_BASE:
00137     {
00138       RSTCUReset.Bit.UART3 = 1;
00139       break;
00140     }
00141     #endif
00142   }
00143 
00144   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00145 }
00146 
00147 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00148  * @brief Initialize the USART/UART peripheral according to the specified parameters in the USART_InitStruct.
00149  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00150  * @param USART_InitStruct: pointer to a USART_InitTypeDef structure.
00151  * @retval None
00152  ************************************************************************************************************/
00153 void USART_Init(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, USART_InitTypeDef* USART_InitStruct)
00154 {
00155   u32 uIPClock = 0;
00156   u32 uIPAddr = (u32)USARTx;
00157 
00158   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00159   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00160   Assert_Param(IS_USART_BAUDRATE(USART_InitStruct->USART_BaudRate));
00161   Assert_Param(IS_USART_WORD_LENGTH(USART_InitStruct->USART_WordLength));
00162   Assert_Param(IS_USART_STOPBITS(USART_InitStruct->USART_StopBits));
00163   Assert_Param(IS_USART_PARITY(USART_InitStruct->USART_Parity));
00164   Assert_Param(IS_USART_MODE(USART_InitStruct->USART_Mode));
00165 
00166   USARTx->CR = (USARTx->CR & CR_CLEAR_Mask) | USART_InitStruct->USART_StopBits |
00167                 USART_InitStruct->USART_WordLength | USART_InitStruct->USART_Parity |
00168                 USART_InitStruct->USART_Mode;
00169 
00170   switch (uIPAddr)
00171   {
00172     #if (!LIBCFG_NO_USART0)
00173     case HT_USART0_BASE:
00174     {
00175       uIPClock = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_USART0);
00176       break;
00177     }
00178     #endif
00179     #if (LIBCFG_USART1)
00180     case HT_USART1_BASE:
00181     {
00182       uIPClock = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_USART1);
00183       break;
00184     }
00185     #endif
00186     case HT_UART0_BASE:
00187     {
00188       uIPClock = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_UART0);
00189       break;
00190     }
00191     #if (LIBCFG_UART1)
00192     case HT_UART1_BASE:
00193     {
00194       uIPClock = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_UART1);
00195       break;
00196     }
00197     #endif
00198     #if (LIBCFG_UART2)
00199     case HT_UART2_BASE:
00200     {
00201       uIPClock = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_UART2);
00202       break;
00203     }
00204     #endif
00205     #if (LIBCFG_UART3)
00206     case HT_UART3_BASE:
00207     {
00208       uIPClock = CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PCLK_UART3);
00209       break;
00210     }
00211     #endif
00212   }
00213 
00214   USARTx->DLR = uIPClock / (u32)USART_InitStruct->USART_BaudRate;
00215 }
00216 
00217 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00218  * @brief Fill each USART_InitStruct member with its default value.
00219  * @param USART_InitStruct: pointer to a USART_InitTypeDef structure.
00220  * @retval None
00221  ************************************************************************************************************/
00222 void USART_StructInit(USART_InitTypeDef* USART_InitStruct)
00223 {
00224   /* USART_InitStruct members default value                                                                 */
00225   USART_InitStruct->USART_BaudRate = 9600;
00226   USART_InitStruct->USART_WordLength = USART_WORDLENGTH_8B;
00227   USART_InitStruct->USART_StopBits = USART_STOPBITS_1;
00228   USART_InitStruct->USART_Parity = USART_PARITY_NO;
00229   USART_InitStruct->USART_Mode = USART_MODE_NORMAL;
00230 }
00231 
00232 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00233  * @brief USART/UART send data to Tx.
00234  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00235  * @param Data: the data to be transmitted.
00236  * @retval None
00237  ************************************************************************************************************/
00238 void USART_SendData(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u16 Data)
00239 {
00240   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00241   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00242   Assert_Param(IS_USART_DATA(Data));
00243 
00244   USARTx->DR = Data;
00245 }
00246 
00247 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00248  * @brief USART/UART receive data from Rx.
00249  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00250  * @retval The received data.
00251  ************************************************************************************************************/
00252 u16 USART_ReceiveData(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx)
00253 {
00254   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00255   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00256 
00257   return (u16)(USARTx->DR);
00258 }

00260 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00261  * @brief Get the specified USART/UART status flags.
00262  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00263  * @param USART_FLAG_x: Specify the flag to be check.
00264  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00265  *     @arg USART_FLAG_RXDNE :
00266  *     @arg USART_FLAG_OE    :
00267  *     @arg USART_FLAG_PE    :
00268  *     @arg USART_FLAG_FE    :
00269  *     @arg USART_FLAG_BI    :
00270  *     @arg USART_FLAG_RXDR  :
00271  *     @arg USART_FLAG_TOUT  :
00272  *     @arg USART_FLAG_TXDE  :
00273  *     @arg USART_FLAG_TXC   :
00274  *     @arg USART_FLAG_RSADD :
00275  *     @arg USART_FLAG_CTSC  :
00276  *     @arg USART_FLAG_CTSS  :
00277  *     @arg USART_FLAG_LBD   :
00278  * @retval SET or RESET
00279  ************************************************************************************************************/
00280 FlagStatus USART_GetFlagStatus(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_FLAG_x)
00281 {
00282   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00283   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00284   Assert_Param(IS_USART_FLAG(USART_FLAG_x));
00285 
00286   if ((USARTx->SR & USART_FLAG_x) != (u32)RESET)
00287   {
00288     return (SET);
00289   }
00290   else
00291   {
00292     return (RESET);
00293   }
00294 }
00295 
00296 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00297  * @brief Get the specified USART/UART INT status.
00298  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00299  * @param USART_INT_x: Specify if the USART/UART interrupt source.
00300  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00301  *     @arg USART_INT_RXDR  :
00302  *     @arg USART_INT_TXDE  :
00303  *     @arg USART_INT_TXC   :
00304  *     @arg USART_INT_OE    :
00305  *     @arg USART_INT_PE    :
00306  *     @arg USART_INT_FE    :
00307  *     @arg USART_INT_BI    :
00308  *     @arg USART_INT_RSADD :
00309  *     @arg USART_INT_TOUT  :
00310  *     @arg USART_INT_CTS   :
00311  *     @arg USART_INT_LBD   :
00312  * @retval SET or RESET
00313  ************************************************************************************************************/
00314 FlagStatus USART_GetIntStatus(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_INT_x)
00315 {
00316   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00317   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00318   Assert_Param(IS_USART_INT(USART_INT_x));
00319 
00320   if ((USARTx->IER & USART_INT_x) != (u32)RESET)
00321   {
00322     return (SET);
00323   }
00324   else
00325   {
00326     return (RESET);
00327   }
00328 }
00329 
00330 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00331  * @brief Clear the specified USART/UART flags.
00332  * @param USARTx: where USARTx is the selected USART/UART from the USART/UART peripherals.
00333  * @param USART_Flag: Specify the flag to check.
00334  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00335  *     @arg USART_FLAG_OE    :
00336  *     @arg USART_FLAG_PE    :
00337  *     @arg USART_FLAG_FE    :
00338  *     @arg USART_FLAG_BI    :
00339  *     @arg USART_FLAG_TOUT  :
00340  *     @arg USART_FLAG_RSADD :
00341  *     @arg USART_FLAG_CTSC  :
00342  *     @arg USART_FLAG_LBD   :
00343  * @retval SET or RESET
00344  ************************************************************************************************************/
00345 void USART_ClearFlag(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_Flag)
00346 {
00347   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00348   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00349   Assert_Param(IS_USART_CLEAR_FLAG(USART_Flag));
00350 
00351   USARTx->SR &= USART_Flag;
00352 }
00353 
00354 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00355  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART/UART interrupts.
00356  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00357  * @param USART_INT_x: Specify if the USART/UART interrupt source to be enabled or disabled.
00358  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00359  *     @arg USART_INT_RXDR  :
00360  *     @arg USART_INT_TXDE  :
00361  *     @arg USART_INT_TXC   :
00362  *     @arg USART_INT_OE    :
00363  *     @arg USART_INT_PE    :
00364  *     @arg USART_INT_FE    :
00365  *     @arg USART_INT_BI    :
00366  *     @arg USART_INT_RSADD :
00367  *     @arg USART_INT_TOUT  :
00368  *     @arg USART_INT_CTS   :
00369 *      @arg USART_INT_LBD   :
00370  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00371  * @retval None
00372  ************************************************************************************************************/
00373 void USART_IntConfig(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_INT_x, ControlStatus NewState)
00374 {
00375   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00376   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00377   Assert_Param(IS_USART_INT(USART_INT_x));
00378   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00379 
00380   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00381   {
00382     USARTx->IER |= USART_INT_x;
00383   }
00384   else
00385   {
00386     USARTx->IER &= ~USART_INT_x;
00387   }
00388 }
00389 
00390 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00391  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART Tx/Rx.
00392  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00393  * @param TxRx: This parameter can be USART_CMD_TX or USART_CMD_RX.
00394  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00395  * @retval None
00396  ************************************************************************************************************/
00397 void USART_TxRxCmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 TxRx, ControlStatus NewState)
00398 {
00399   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00400   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00401   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00402   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00403   {
00404     USARTx->CR |= (USART_EN_ON << TxRx);
00405   }
00406   else
00407   {
00408     USARTx->CR &= ~(USART_EN_ON << TxRx);
00409   }
00410 }
00411 
00412 #if (LIBCFG_PDMA)
00413 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00414  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART/UART PDMA interface.
00415  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00416  * @param USART_PDMAREQ: specify the USART/UART PDMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled.
00417  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00418  *     @arg USART_PDMAREQ_TX
00419  *     @arg USART_PDMAREQ_RX
00420  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00421  * @retval None
00422  ************************************************************************************************************/
00423 void USART_PDMACmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_PDMAREQ, ControlStatus NewState)
00424 {
00425   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00426   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00427   Assert_Param(IS_USART_PDMA_REQ(USART_PDMAREQ));
00428   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00429 
00430   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00431   {
00432     USARTx->CR |= USART_PDMAREQ;
00433   }
00434   else
00435   {
00436     USARTx->CR &= ~USART_PDMAREQ;
00437   }
00438 }
00439 #endif

00441 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00442  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART/UART break control function.
00443  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00444  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00445  * @retval None
00446  ************************************************************************************************************/
00447 void USART_ForceBreakCmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, ControlStatus NewState)
00448 {
00449   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00450   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00451   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00452 
00453   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00454   {
00455     USARTx->CR |= USART_BREAK_ON;
00456   }
00457   else
00458   {
00459     USARTx->CR &= USART_BREAK_OFF;
00460   }
00461 }
00462 
00463 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00464  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART/UART stick parity function.
00465  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00466  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00467  * @retval None
00468  ************************************************************************************************************/
00469 void USART_StickParityCmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, ControlStatus NewState)
00470 {
00471   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00472   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00473   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00474 
00475   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00476   {
00477     USARTx->CR |= USART_SPE_ON | USART_PBE_ON;
00478   }
00479   else
00480   {
00481     USARTx->CR &= USART_SPE_OFF;
00482   }
00483 }
00484 
00485 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00486  * @brief Configure the stick parity value of the USART/UART.
00487  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the UxART peripheral.
00488  * @param USART_StickParity: Specify the stick parity of the USART/UART.
00489  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00490  *     @arg USART_STICK_LOW
00491  *     @arg USART_STICK_HIGH
00492  * @retval None
00493  ************************************************************************************************************/
00494 void USART_StickParityConfig(HT_USART_TypeDef * USARTx, u32 USART_StickParity)
00495 {
00496   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00497   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00498   Assert_Param(IS_USART_STICK_PARITY(USART_StickParity));
00499 
00500   if (USART_StickParity != USART_STICK_HIGH)
00501   {
00502     USARTx->CR |= USART_STICK_LOW;
00503   }
00504   else
00505   {
00506     USARTx->CR &= USART_STICK_HIGH;
00507   }
00508 }
00509 
00510 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00511  * @brief Set the specified USART guard time.
00512  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00513  * @param USART_GuardTime: Specify the guard time.
00514  * @retval None
00515  ************************************************************************************************************/
00516 void USART_SetGuardTime(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_GuardTime)
00517 {
00518   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00519   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00520   Assert_Param(IS_USART_GUARD_TIME(USART_GuardTime));
00521 
00522   USARTx->TPR = (USARTx->TPR & TPR_TG_Mask) | (USART_GuardTime << 0x08);
00523 }
00524 
00525 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00526  * @brief Configure the Tx/Rx FIFO Interrupt Trigger Level.
00527  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00528  * @param TxRx: This parameter can be USART_CMD_TX or USART_CMD_RX.
00529  * @param USART_tl: Specify the USART Tx/Rx FIFO interrupt trigger level.
00530  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00531  *     @arg USART_RXTL_01
00532  *     @arg USART_RXTL_02
00533  *     @arg USART_RXTL_04
00534  *     @arg USART_RXTL_06
00535  *     @arg USART_TXTL_00
00536  *     @arg USART_TXTL_02
00537  *     @arg USART_TXTL_04
00538  *     @arg USART_TXTL_06
00539  * @retval None
00540  ************************************************************************************************************/
00541 void USART_TXRXTLConfig(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 TxRx, u32 USART_tl)
00542 {
00543   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00544   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00545   Assert_Param(IS_USART_TL(USART_tl));
00546 
00547   USARTx->FCR = (USARTx->FCR & ~(FCR_TL_Mask << (TxRx * 2))) | (USART_tl << (TxRx * 2));
00548 }
00549 
00550 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00551  * @brief Set the USART FIFO time-out value.
00552  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00553  * @param USART_TimeOut: Specify the time-out value.
00554  * @retval None
00555  ************************************************************************************************************/
00556 void USART_SetTimeOutValue(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_TimeOut)
00557 {
00558   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00559   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00560   Assert_Param(IS_USART_TIMEOUT(USART_TimeOut));
00561 
00562   USARTx->TPR = (USARTx->TPR & TPR_RXTOIC_Mask) | USART_TimeOut | USART_RXTOEN_ON;
00563 }
00564 
00565 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00566  * @brief Clear both the write and read point in USART Tx FIFO or Rx FIFO.
00567  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00568  * @param USART_FIFODirection: Determine TX FIFO or Rx FIFO that is to be reset.
00569  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00570  *     @arg USART_FIFO_TX
00571  *     @arg USART_FIFO_RX
00572  * @retval None
00573  ************************************************************************************************************/
00574 void USART_FIFOReset(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_FIFODirection)
00575 {
00576   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00577   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00578   Assert_Param(IS_USART_FIFO_DIRECTION(USART_FIFODirection));
00579 
00580   USARTx->FCR |= USART_FIFODirection;
00581 }
00582 
00583 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00584  * @brief Return the status of specified USART FIFO.
00585  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00586  * @param USART_FIFODirection: specify the FIFO that is to be check.
00587  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00588  *     @arg USART_FIFO_TX
00589  *     @arg USART_FIFO_RX
00590  * @retval The number of data in Tx FIFO or Rx FIFO.
00591  ************************************************************************************************************/
00592 u8 USART_GetFIFOStatus(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_FIFODirection)
00593 {
00594   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00595   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00596   Assert_Param(IS_USART_FIFO_DIRECTION(USART_FIFODirection));
00597 
00598   if (USART_FIFODirection == USART_FIFO_TX)
00599   {
00600     return (u8)((USARTx->FCR & 0xF0000) >> 16);
00601   }
00602   else
00603   {
00604     return (u8)((USARTx->FCR & 0xF000000) >> 24);
00605   }
00606 }
00607 
00608 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00609  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART hardware flow control.
00610  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00611  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00612  * @retval None
00613  ************************************************************************************************************/
00614 void USART_HardwareFlowControlCmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, ControlStatus NewState)
00615 {
00616   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00617   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00618   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00619 
00620   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00621   {
00622     USARTx->CR |= USART_HFCEN_ON;
00623   }
00624   else
00625   {
00626     USARTx->CR &= USART_HFCEN_OFF;
00627   }
00628 }
00629 
00630 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00631  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART IrDA interface.
00632  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00633  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00634  * @retval None
00635  ************************************************************************************************************/
00636 void USART_IrDACmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, ControlStatus NewState)
00637 {
00638   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00639   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00640   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00641 
00642   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00643   {
00644     USARTx->ICR |= USART_IRDA_ON;
00645   }
00646   else
00647   {
00648     USARTx->ICR &= USART_IRDA_OFF;
00649   }
00650 }
00651 
00652 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00653  * @brief Configure the USART IrDA interface.
00654  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00655  * @param USART_IrDAMode: Specify the USART IrDA mode.
00656  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00657  *     @arg USART_IRDA_LOWPOWER
00658  *     @arg USART_IRDA_NORMAL
00659  * @retval None
00660  ************************************************************************************************************/
00661 void USART_IrDAConfig(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_IrDAMode)
00662 {
00663   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00664   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00665   Assert_Param(IS_USART_IRDA_MODE(USART_IrDAMode));
00666 
00667   if (USART_IrDAMode != USART_IRDA_NORMAL)
00668   {
00669     USARTx->ICR |= USART_IRDA_LOWPOWER;
00670   }
00671   else
00672   {
00673     USARTx->ICR &= USART_IRDA_NORMAL;
00674   }
00675 }
00676 
00677 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00678  * @brief Set the specified USART IrDA prescaler.
00679  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00680  * @param USART_IrDAPrescaler: Specify the USART IrDA prescaler.
00681  * @retval None
00682  ************************************************************************************************************/
00683 void USART_SetIrDAPrescaler(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_IrDAPrescaler)
00684 {
00685   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00686   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00687   Assert_Param(IS_USART_IRDA_PRESCALER(USART_IrDAPrescaler));
00688 
00689   USARTx->ICR = (USARTx->ICR & ICR_IRDAPSC_Mask) | (USART_IrDAPrescaler << 0x08);
00690 }
00691 
00692 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00693  * @brief Enable the IrDA transmitter or receiver.
00694  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral, x can be 0 or 1.
00695  * @param USART_IrDADirection: Specify the USART IrDA direction select.
00696  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00697  *     @arg USART_IRDA_TX
00698  *     @arg USART_IRDA_RX
00699  * @retval None
00700  ************************************************************************************************************/
00701 void USART_IrDADirectionConfig(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_IrDADirection)
00702 {
00703   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00704   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00705   Assert_Param(IS_USART_IRDA_DIRECTION(USART_IrDADirection));
00706 
00707   if (USART_IrDADirection != USART_IRDA_RX)
00708   {
00709     USARTx->ICR |= USART_IRDA_TX;
00710   }
00711   else
00712   {
00713     USARTx->ICR &= USART_IRDA_RX;
00714   }
00715 }
00716 
00717 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00718  * @brief Enable or Disable inverting serial output/input function of IrDA on the specified USART.
00719  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00720  * @param inout: This parameter can be USART_CMD_OUT or USART_CMD_IN.
00721  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00722  * @retval None
00723  ************************************************************************************************************/
00724 void USART_IrDAInvtCmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 inout, ControlStatus NewState)
00725 {
00726   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00727   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00728   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00729 
00730   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00731   {
00732     USARTx->ICR |= (USART_INV_ON << inout);
00733   }
00734   else
00735   {
00736     USARTx->ICR &= ~(USART_INV_ON << inout);
00737   }
00738 }
00739 
00740 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00741  * @brief Configure the polarity of USART RS485 transmitter enable signal.
00742  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00743  * @param USART_RS485Polarity: Specify the polarity of USART RS485 Tx enable signal.
00744  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00745  *     @arg USART_RS485POL_LOW
00746  *     @arg USART_RS485POL_HIGH
00747  * @retval None
00748  ************************************************************************************************************/
00749 void USART_RS485TxEnablePolarityConfig(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_RS485Polarity)
00750 {
00751   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00752   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00753   Assert_Param(IS_USART_RS485_POLARITY(USART_RS485Polarity));
00754 
00755   if (USART_RS485Polarity != USART_RS485POLARITY_HIGH)
00756   {
00757     USARTx->RCR |= USART_RS485POLARITY_LOW;
00758   }
00759   else
00760   {
00761     USARTx->RCR &= USART_RS485POLARITY_HIGH;
00762   }
00763 }
00764 
00765 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00766  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART RS485 normal multi-drop operation mode.
00767  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00768  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00769  * @retval None
00770  ************************************************************************************************************/
00771 void USART_RS485NMMCmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, ControlStatus NewState)

00775   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00776 
00777   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00778   {
00779     USARTx->RCR |= USART_RS485NMM_ON;
00780   }
00781   else
00782   {
00783     USARTx->RCR &= USART_RS485NMM_OFF;
00784   }
00785 }
00786 
00787 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00788  * @brief Enable or Disable the USART RS485 normal multi-drop operation mode.
00789  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00790  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00791  * @retval None

00793 void USART_RS485AADCmd(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, ControlStatus NewState)

00802   }
00803   else
00804   {
00805     USARTx->RCR &= USART_RS485AAD_OFF;
00806   }
00807 }
00808 
00809 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00810  * @brief Set the specified USART RS485 address match value.
00811  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00812  * @param USART_AddressMatchValue: specify the USART RS485 address match value.
00813  * @retval None
00814  ************************************************************************************************************/
00815 void USART_SetAddressMatchValue(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_AddressMatchValue)
00816 {
00817   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00818   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00819   Assert_Param(IS_USART_ADDRESS_MATCH_VALUE(USART_AddressMatchValue));
00820 
00821   USARTx->RCR = (USARTx->RCR & RS485CR_ADDM_Mask) | (u32)(USART_AddressMatchValue << 0x08);
00822 }
00823 
00824 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00825  * @brief Initialize the clock of the USART peripheral according to the specified parameters
00826  *        in the USART_ClockInitStruct.
00827  * @param USARTx: Parameter to select the USART peripheral.
00828  * @param USART_SynClock_InitStruct: pointer to a USART_SynClock_InitTypeDef structure.
00829  * @retval None
00830  ************************************************************************************************************/
00831 void USART_SynClockInit(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, USART_SynClock_InitTypeDef* USART_SynClock_InitStruct)
00832 {
00833   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00834   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00835   Assert_Param(IS_USART_SYNCHRONOUS_CLOCK(USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockEnable));
00836   Assert_Param(IS_USART_SYNCHRONOUS_PHASE(USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockPhase));
00837   Assert_Param(IS_USART_SYNCHRONOUS_POLARITY(USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockPolarity));
00838   Assert_Param(IS_USART_TRANSFER_MODE(USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_TransferSelectMode));
00839 
00840   USARTx->SCR = USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockEnable | USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockPhase |
00841                 USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockPolarity;
00842 
00843   USARTx->CR = (USARTx->CR & TRSM_CLEAR_Mask) | USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_TransferSelectMode;
00844 }
00845 
00846 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00847  * @brief Fill each USART_SynClockInitStruct member with its default value.
00848  * @param USART_SynClock_InitStruct: pointer to a USART_SynClock_InitTypeDef structure.
00849  * @retval None
00850  ************************************************************************************************************/
00851 void USART_SynClockStructInit(USART_SynClock_InitTypeDef* USART_SynClock_InitStruct)
00852 {
00853   /* USART_ClockInitStruct members default value                                                            */
00854   USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockEnable =  USART_SYN_CLOCK_DISABLE;
00855   USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockPhase = USART_SYN_CLOCK_PHASE_FIRST;
00856   USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_ClockPolarity = USART_SYN_CLOCK_POLARITY_LOW;
00857   USART_SynClock_InitStruct->USART_TransferSelectMode = USART_LSB_FIRST;
00858 }
00859 
00860 #if (LIBCFG_USART_LIN)
00861 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00862  * @brief USART/UART LIN Mode send break to Tx.
00863  * @param USARTx: where USARTx is the selected USART/UART from the USART/UART peripherals.
00864  * @retval None
00865  ************************************************************************************************************/
00866 void USART_LIN_SendBreak(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx)
00867 {
00868   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00869   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00870 
00871   USARTx->CR |= USART_LINSENDBREAK;
00872 }
00873 
00874 
00875 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00876  * @brief Configure the break detection length in LIN mode.
00877  * @param USARTx: where USARTx is the selected USART/UART from the USART/UART peripherals.
00878  * @param length: data length in byte.
00879  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00880  *     @arg USART_LINLENGTH_11BIT
00881  *     @arg USART_LINLENGTH_10BIT
00882  * @retval None
00883  ************************************************************************************************************/
00884 void USART_LIN_LengthSelect(HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx, u32 USART_LIN_Length)
00885 {
00886   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00887   Assert_Param(IS_USART(USARTx));
00888   Assert_Param(IS_USART_LINLENGTH(USART_LIN_Length));
00889 
00890   if (USART_LIN_Length != USART_LINLENGTH_10BIT)
00891   {
00892     USARTx->CR |= USART_LINLENGTH_11BIT;
00893   }
00894   else
00895   {
00896     USARTx->CR &= USART_LINLENGTH_10BIT;
00897   }
00898 }
00899 #endif
